Ayurvedha_description:
Tulsi (Holy Basil) Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 10-12 fresh tulsi leaves in 1-2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Optionally, add a pinch of black pepper and honey.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of tulsi tea 2-3 times a day to help reduce fever and boost immunity.

Ginger Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1-inch of fresh ginger in 1-2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain and add honey if desired.
How to take: Consume 1-2 cups a day to help fight fever with its anti-inflammatory and antiviral properties.

Turmeric Milk:
How to prepare: Heat 1 cup of milk, then stir in 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder. Optionally, add a pinch of black pepper and honey for taste.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of turmeric milk once a day, preferably before bed, to reduce inflammation and boost the immune response.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of diluted Tulsi and Ginger tea; 1/4 tsp Turmeric in milk.
Children (6-12 Years): Moderate doses of Tulsi, Ginger tea, and 1/4-1/2 tsp Turmeric in milk.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of Tulsi, Ginger tea, and 1/2-1 tsp Turmeric in milk.
Elderly: Full but cautious doses of Tulsi, Ginger tea, and 1/2 tsp Turmeric in milk.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Quince (Cydonia Oblonga) Infusion:
How to prepare: Boil 1-2 fresh quince slices in 2 cups of water for 15 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of quince infusion 2-3 times a day to help reduce fever and provide hydration.

Mint (Mentha) Tea:
How to prepare: Boil a handful of fresh mint leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain and add honey if desired.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of mint tea 2-3 times a day to help cool the body and ease fever symptoms.

Henna Leaves Paste:
How to prepare: Grind fresh henna leaves with a little water to make a smooth paste.
How to take: Apply the paste to the forehead and pulse points to help cool the body and relieve fever. Leave it on for 30 minutes before rinsing.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of diluted quince infusion; mint tea can be given in very small quantities.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of quince infusion and 1 cup of mint tea.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of quince infusion and mint tea; henna paste as described.
Elderly: Full doses of quince infusion and mint tea; henna paste as described, but monitor for any skin sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Nilavembu Decoction:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of dried Nilavembu leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1/4 cup (approximately 60 ml) of Nilavembu decoction 2-3 times a day to help reduce fever and boost immunity.

Papaya Leaf Juice:
How to prepare: Crush 2-3 fresh papaya leaves and extract the juice, then strain it well.
How to take: Drink 2 tablespoons of papaya leaf juice twice a day to reduce fever and boost platelet count.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Nilavembu decoction or Papaya leaf juice.
Children (6-12 Years): 1-2 tablespoons of Nilavembu decoction or Papaya leaf juice.
Teens/Adults: 1/4 cup of Nilavembu decoction or 2 tablespoons of Papaya leaf juice.
Elderly: 1/4 cup of Nilavembu decoction or 2 tablespoons of Papaya leaf juice.
Homeopathy_description:
Belladonna :
How to prepare: Take 5 drops of Belladonna liquid (a plant extract you can buy) and mix it in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Gelsemium:
How to prepare: Take 5 drops of Gelsemium liquid (a plant extract you can buy) and mix it in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for side effects like feeling sleepy.

Ayurvedha_description:
Instructions:
Bring 2 cups of water to a boil.
Add ginger slices, licorice root, and cinnamon.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Strain the tea into a cup.
Stir in honey after the tea has cooled slightly (to preserve its benefits).

How to consume:
Drink this tea 2-3 times a day to help relieve cold and cough symptoms.

Who should consume:
Infants (below 1 year): Avoid honey and licorice root. Use very mild remedies with caution.
Toddlers (1-5 years): Small, diluted amounts of ginger tea, honey, and cinnamon.
Children (6-12 years): Moderated doses of ginger, honey, cinnamon, and licorice tea (with caution).
Teens (13+ years) and Adults: Full doses of all remedies.
Elderly (60+ years): Cautious use of licorice root, moderate doses of other remedies.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Figs with Honey:
How to prepare: Soak 2-3 dried figs in warm water overnight. In the morning, mash the figs and mix with 1 tablespoon of honey.
How to take: Consume this mixture once a day to help soothe the throat and alleviate cough symptoms.

Fenugreek Seeds Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1 teaspoon of fenugreek seeds in 2 cups of water for 10-15 minutes. Strain and let it cool slightly.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of fenugreek tea 2-3 times a day to help reduce mucus and relieve cough.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/2 a mashed fig with a little honey (ensure no allergies); 1/4 cup of diluted fenugreek tea.
Children (6-12 Years): 1-2 figs with honey and 1/2 cup of fenugreek tea.Teens/Adults: Full doses of figs with honey and fenugreek tea as described.
Elderly: Full doses of figs with honey and fenugreek tea, but monitor for any digestive sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Adathodai (Justicia adhatoda) Decoction:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of dried Adathodai leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1/4 cup (approximately 60 ml) of Adathodai decoction 2-3 times a day to help relieve cold and cough symptoms.

Thippili (Piper longum) Powder:
How to prepare: Grind dried Thippili (long pepper) into a fine powder. Mix 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder with honey or warm water.
How to take: Consume 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder mixed with honey or warm water twice a day to alleviate cough.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Adathodai decoction or a small pinch of Thippili powder mixed with honey.
Children (6-12 Years): 1-2 tablespoons of Adathodai decoction or 1/4 teaspoon of Thippili powder.
Teens/Adults: 1/4 cup of Adathodai decoction or 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder.
Elderly: 1/4 cup of Adathodai decoction or 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder.
Homeopathy_description:
Allium Cepa:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Allium Cepa liquid (a plant extract you can buy) in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Arsenicum Album:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Arsenicum Album liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Amla (Indian Gooseberry):
Take 1 teaspoon of amla juice or powder with warm water 1-2 times a day to improve digestion.

Fennel Seeds:
Chew 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds after meals or boil 1 teaspoon in water and drink it to relieve bloating and indigestion.

Cumin Seeds:
Boil 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds in water for 5 minutes and drink it after meals to aid digestion and reduce acidity.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of fennel seed water; avoid amla and cumin.
Children (6-12 Years): Mild fennel and cumin water; 1/4 tsp amla powder.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of amla, fennel, and cumin (1 tsp each).
Elderly: Moderate doses of amla, fennel, and cumin (1/2-1 tsp).

Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Coriander Water:
How to prepare: Soak 1 tablespoon of coriander seeds in 2 cups of water overnight. In the morning, strain the water and discard the seeds.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of coriander water before meals to help improve digestion and reduce acidity.

Fennel Seeds Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain and let it cool slightly.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of fennel tea after meals to help relieve bloating and indigestion.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 cup of diluted coriander water; 1/4 cup of fennel tea (cooled).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of coriander water and 1/2 cup of fennel tea.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of coriander water and fennel tea as described.
Elderly: Full doses of coriander water and fennel tea, but monitor for any digestive sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Kadukkai (Terminalia chebula) Powder:
How to prepare: Dry the Kadukkai fruit and grind it into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder with warm water and drink once a day to help relieve indigestion and acidity.

Jeeragam (Cumin Seeds) Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds in 1-2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Jeeragam tea after meals to aid digestion and reduce acidity.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder mixed with warm water.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1/2 cup of Jeeragam tea.
Teens/Adults: 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1 cup of Jeeragam tea.
Elderly: 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1 cup of Jeeragam tea.
Homeopathy_description:
Nux Vomica Remedy :
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Nux Vomica liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Carbo Veg:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Carbo Veg liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Sandalwood Paste:
Apply a small amount of sandalwood paste on the forehead and temples to cool and relieve tension headaches.

Peppermint Oil:
Ingredients:
Fresh peppermint leaves (about 1 cup)
A carrier oil (e.g., olive oil, coconut oil, or almond oil)
A jar with a tight-fitting lid
Steps:
Prepare the Leaves:
Lightly crush the peppermint leaves with your hands or a spoon to release the natural oils.
Combine with Oil:
Place the crushed leaves in a clean glass jar and pour enough carrier oil to cover them completely.
Infuse the Oil:
Seal the jar and place it in a sunny spot for 1-2 weeks. Shake the jar gently once a day to help release the oils from the leaves.
Strain:
After 1-2 weeks, strain the oil to remove the peppermint leaves. Store the infused oil in a clean bottle.

Triphala:
Take 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of Triphala powder with warm water before bed to detoxify and improve digestion, which can help prevent headaches related to digestive issues.

Who should consume:
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid sandalwood paste; a very diluted peppermint oil (only if prescribed) and very small amounts of Triphala under a doctor’s guidance.
Children (6-12 Years): Mild sandalwood paste on the forehead; 1 drop of diluted peppermint oil; 1/4 teaspoon of Triphala powder.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: Sandalwood paste on the forehead; 2-3 drops of peppermint oil (diluted); 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of Triphala powder.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): Sandalwood paste; 1-2 drops of diluted peppermint oil; 1/2 teaspoon of Triphala powder.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Clove Oil Application:
How to prepare: Dilute 1-2 drops of clove oil in 1 tablespoon of carrier oil (such as coconut or olive oil).
How to take: Gently massage the diluted clove oil onto the temples and forehead. Repeat as needed for relief from headache pain.

Almond Paste:
How to prepare: Soak 5-6 almonds overnight, then peel and grind them into a smooth paste with a little water.
How to take: Apply the almond paste to the forehead and leave it on for 30 minutes before rinsing with water to help soothe headaches.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Almond paste can be applied in small amounts; avoid clove oil.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 teaspoon of almond paste can be used; clove oil should be diluted properly if used.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of clove oil application and almond paste as described.
Elderly: Full doses of clove oil application and almond paste, but monitor for skin sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Karpooravalli (Indian Borage) Juice:
How to prepare: Crush a handful of fresh Karpooravalli leaves to extract the juice. Strain it well to remove any solids.
How to take: Drink 1 tablespoon of Karpooravalli juice twice a day to help alleviate headache symptoms.

Karpooravalli Herbal Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 10-12 fresh Karpooravalli leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Karpooravalli tea 1-2 times a day for headache relief.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Karpooravalli juice or tea.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 tablespoon of Karpooravalli juice or 1/2 cup of herbal tea.
Teens/Adults: 1 tablespoon of Karpooravalli juice or 1 cup of herbal tea.
Elderly: 1 tablespoon of Karpooravalli juice or 1 cup of herbal tea.
Homeopathy_description:
Bryonia:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Bryonia liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until the headache improves.

Belladonna:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Belladonna liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until the headache improves.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for side effects like dizziness.

Ayurvedha:
Eucalyptus oil
Ginger tea
Steam inhalation
Ayurvedha_description:
Eucalyptus Oil: 
Steps:
Prepare Leaves:
Rinse fresh eucalyptus leaves and pat them dry.
Crush or chop the leaves to release their oils.
Infusion Process:
Place the crushed eucalyptus leaves in a large pot.
Cover the leaves with carrier oil.
Heat the mixture over low heat for several hours (2-4 hours). Ensure the oil does not boil; keep it at a gentle simmer.
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Strain the Oil:
After heating, let the oil cool.
Strain out the eucalyptus leaves using a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth.
Transfer the infused oil into a clean jar or bottle for storage.

Ginger Tea:
Drink 1 cup, 2-3 times a day.

Steam Inhalation:
Inhale steam from a bowl of hot water or use a steam inhaler for 10-15 minutes, 2-3 times a day.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid Eucalyptus oil; use ginger tea and steam inhalation with caution under a doctor’s guidance.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Use very diluted eucalyptus oil in a diffuser; offer mild ginger tea; use steam inhalation with care (ensure it's not too hot).
Children (6-12 Years): Use a few drops of eucalyptus oil in a diffuser or diluted for topical use; drink ginger tea 1-2 times a day; do steam inhalation with a towel over the head.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: Use 5-10 drops of eucalyptus oil in a diffuser or diluted for topical application; drink ginger tea 2-3 times a day; do steam inhalation 2-3 times a day.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): Use eucalyptus oil cautiously (diffuser or diluted); drink ginger tea; do steam inhalation 1-2 times a day.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Honey with Warm Water:
How to prepare: Mix 1-2 tablespoons of honey in a glass of warm water.
How to take: Drink this mixture 1-2 times a day to help soothe the throat and reduce sinus inflammation.

Black Seed (Nigella Sativa) Oil:
How to prepare: Use cold-pressed black seed oil. You can also grind 1 teaspoon of black seeds into a powder.
How to take: Take 1 teaspoon of black seed oil daily or mix 1/2 teaspoon of black seed powder with honey and consume once a day to help alleviate sinus symptoms.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of honey mixed with warm water (ensure no allergies).
Children (6-12 Years): 1 tablespoon of honey with warm water; 1/4 teaspoon of black seed powder mixed with honey.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of honey in warm water and black seed oil or powder as described.
Elderly: Full doses of honey in warm water and black seed oil or powder as described, but monitor for any sensitivities.
Siddha_description:
Tulsi Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 10-12 fresh Tulsi leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Optionally, add a pinch of black pepper and honey for taste.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Tulsi tea 2-3 times a day to help relieve sinusitis symptoms.

Tulsi Steam Inhalation:
How to prepare: Boil 2 cups of water with a handful of fresh Tulsi leaves. Remove from heat and inhale the steam.
How to take: Inhale the steam for 5-10 minutes once or twice a day to help clear nasal passages and relieve congestion.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Tulsi tea (diluted).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of Tulsi tea.
Teens/Adults: 1 cup of Tulsi tea.
Elderly: 1 cup of Tulsi tea.
Homeopathy_description:
Kali Bichromicum:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Kali Bichromicum liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Silicea:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Silicea liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Bitter Gourd:
Juice: Drink 1/2 cup of bitter gourd juice on an empty stomach in the morning.
Cooked: Add bitter gourd to your meals 2-3 times a week.

Fenugreek Seeds:
Soaked: Soak 1-2 teaspoons of fenugreek seeds in water overnight. Drink the water and eat the seeds in the morning.
Powdered: Mix 1/2 teaspoon of fenugreek seed powder into a glass of water or yogurt and consume once daily.

Amla:
Raw: Eat 1-2 fresh amla fruits daily.
Juice: Drink 1-2 tablespoons of amla juice mixed with water in the morning.
Powder: Mix 1/2 teaspoon of amla powder into water or smoothies and consume once daily.

Who should consume:
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid bitter gourd juice; offer very small amounts of soaked fenugreek seeds and amla powder mixed with food.
Children (6-12 Years): Add small amounts of cooked bitter gourd to meals; use 1/4 teaspoon of fenugreek powder; give 1/2 to 1 amla fruit or 1/4 teaspoon amla powder.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: Drink 1/2 cup bitter gourd juice; use 1-2 teaspoons soaked fenugreek seeds or 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek powder; consume 1-2 amla fruits or 1/2 to 1 teaspoon amla powder.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): Drink 1/4 to 1/2 cup bitter gourd juice; use 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds or powder; consume 1 amla fruit or 1/2 teaspoon amla powder.

Unani_description:
Jamun Juice:
How to prepare: Crush 10-15 ripe jamun fruits and extract the juice. Strain to remove any pulp.
How to take: Drink 1/2 cup of fresh jamun juice daily, preferably in the morning on an empty stomach, to help manage blood sugar levels.

Kalonji Seeds (Nigella Sativa) Powder:
How to prepare: Dry roast 1-2 teaspoons of kalonji seeds, then grind them into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1/2 teaspoon of kalonji powder with honey or water and consume once daily to help regulate blood sugar.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of jamun juice or kalonji powder (consult a healthcare professional first).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4-1/2 cup of jamun juice and 1/4 teaspoon of kalonji powder.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of jamun juice and kalonji powder as described.
Elderly: Full doses of jamun juice and kalonji powder, but monitor for any sensitivities or interactions with medications.
Siddha_description:
Seenthil Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of dried Seenthil leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1/4 cup (approximately 60 ml) of Seenthil tea twice a day to help manage blood sugar levels.

Vilva Powder:
How to prepare: Dry the Vilva fruit and grind it into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder with warm water and drink once a day to aid in diabetes management.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Not recommended.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Seenthil tea or Vilva powder.
Teens/Adults: 1/4 cup of Seenthil tea or 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Elderly: 1/4 cup of Seenthil tea or 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Homeopathy_description:
Syzygium Jambolanum:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Syzygium Jambolanum liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours to help regulate blood sugar levels.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed, but monitor blood sugar levels.
Elderly: Safe, but consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing.

Ayurvedha:
Turmeric milk
Aswagandha
Sesame oil massage
Ayurvedha_description:
Turmeric Milk:
Mix 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder in a cup of warm milk. Drink once daily, preferably before bedtime.

Ashwagandha:
Take 300-500 mg of ashwagandha powder or capsules daily, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Sesame Oil Massage:
Warm 2-3 tablespoons of sesame oil and gently massage it into affected joints. Do this 2-3 times a day.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid turmeric milk; use ashwagandha only under a doctor’s guidance; very gentle sesame oil massage.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 cup turmeric milk; 100-250 mg ashwagandha powder or capsules; gentle sesame oil massage.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1/2 to 1 cup turmeric milk; 300-500 mg ashwagandha daily; sesame oil massage 2-3 times a day.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1/2 cup turmeric milk; 300 mg ashwagandha; sesame oil massage 1-2 times a day.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Olive Oil Massage:
How to prepare: Warm 2-3 tablespoons of olive oil slightly (ensure it’s not too hot).
How to take: Gently massage the warm olive oil onto the affected joints for 10-15 minutes. Repeat this 1-2 times daily for relief.

Turmeric Paste:
How to prepare: Mix 1 tablespoon of turmeric powder with enough water to form a thick paste. Optionally, you can add a few drops of olive oil.
How to take: Apply the turmeric paste to the affected joints and leave it on for 30 minutes before rinsing with warm water. Do this 2-3 times a week.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of diluted turmeric paste (consult a healthcare professional first).
Children (6-12 Years): 1 teaspoon of turmeric paste applied as described; olive oil massage as needed.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of olive oil massage and turmeric paste as described.
Elderly: Full doses of olive oil massage and turmeric paste, but monitor for any skin sensitivity or irritation.
Siddha_description:
Kollu (Horse Gram) Soup:
How to prepare: Boil 1/4 cup of soaked Kollu in 3 cups of water for 30 minutes. Strain and season with salt and pepper.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Kollu soup once a day to help reduce inflammation and joint pain.

Castor Oil Massage:
How to prepare: Warm 2 tablespoons of castor oil slightly until it is comfortable to touch.
How to take: Massage the warm castor oil onto the affected joints for 10-15 minutes, twice a day, to relieve pain and improve mobility.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 tablespoon of Kollu soup (diluted).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 cup of Kollu soup or castor oil massage (with parental guidance).
Teens/Adults: 1 cup of Kollu soup and castor oil massage.
Elderly: 1 cup of Kollu soup and castor oil massage.
Homeopathy_description:
Rhus Tox:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Rhus Tox liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Arnica:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Arnica liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects like skin irritation.

Ayurvedha_description:
Vasaka (Malabar Nut): 
Take 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of vasaka powder mixed with honey or warm water, 1-2 times daily. Alternatively, you can use vasaka syrup as directed on the product label.

Honey: 
Take 1-2 teaspoons of honey daily, either directly or mixed into warm water or herbal teas.

Ginger: 
Drink 1 cup of ginger tea (made with 1-inch fresh ginger boiled in 1-2 cups of water) 2-3 times daily, or use ginger powder (1/4 teaspoon) in warm water or smoothies.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid honey and vasaka; use ginger tea very cautiously (consult a doctor first).
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon vasaka powder (if approved), a very small amount of honey; diluted ginger tea (1-2 teaspoons).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon vasaka powder with honey or warm water; 1 teaspoon honey daily; 1/4 to 1/2 cup ginger tea 2 times daily.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1/2 to 1 teaspoon vasaka powder; 1-2 teaspoons honey daily; 1 cup ginger tea 2-3 times daily.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1/2 teaspoon vasaka powder; 1-2 teaspoons honey; 1/2 to 1 cup ginger tea 1-2 times daily.

Unani_description:
Honey with Black Seeds:
How to prepare: Mix 1 teaspoon of black seed (kalonji) powder with 1 tablespoon of honey.
How to take: Consume this mixture once daily to help soothe the airways and reduce asthma symptoms.

Figs (Fresh or Dried):
How to prepare: Soak 2-3 dried figs in warm water overnight. In the morning, mash the figs if needed.
How to take: Eat the soaked figs on an empty stomach each morning to help support lung health and ease breathing.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of black seed powder mixed with honey (consult a healthcare professional first); 1/2 soaked fig.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of black seed powder with honey; 1-2 soaked figs.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of honey with black seeds and figs as described.
Elderly: Full doses of honey with black seeds and figs, but monitor for any sensitivities or interactions with medications.
Siddha_description:
Thalisapathri Decoction:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of dried Thalisapathri leaves in 2 cups of water for 10-15 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1/4 cup (approximately 60 ml) of Thalisapathri decoction 2-3 times a day to help alleviate asthma symptoms.

Thippili Powder:
How to prepare: Grind dried Thippili (Long Pepper) into a fine powder. Mix 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder with honey or warm water.
How to take: Consume 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder mixed with honey or warm water twice a day to help relieve asthma symptoms.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Thippili powder mixed with honey (if no allergies).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder or 1/4 cup of Thalisapathri decoction.
Teens/Adults: 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder or 1/4 cup of Thalisapathri decoction.
Elderly: 1/2 teaspoon of Thippili powder or 1/4 cup of Thalisapathri decoction.
Homeopathy_description:
Blatta Orientalis:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Blatta Orientalis liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Antimonium Tart:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Antimonium Tart liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Neem: 
Consume neem in the form of neem capsules or neem juice (follow dosage instructions on the product). For topical use, apply neem paste made from ground neem leaves to affected areas.

Turmeric Paste:
Mix 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder with a few drops of water or honey to make a paste. Apply this paste to the affected skin and leave it on for 15-30 minutes before rinsing off. Use 2-3 times a week.

Sandalwood: 
Mix sandalwood powder with water or rose water to form a paste. Apply to affected areas, leave on for 20-30 minutes, then rinse off. Use 2-3 times a week.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid neem and turmeric paste; use sandalwood paste very cautiously.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Use neem paste and turmeric paste sparingly; sandalwood paste can be used gently on small areas.
Children (6-12 Years): Neem capsules or juice; turmeric paste applied to affected areas; sandalwood paste 2-3 times a week.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: Neem capsules or juice; turmeric paste applied to skin; sandalwood paste 2-3 times a week.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): Neem capsules or juice; turmeric paste with caution; sandalwood paste 1-2 times a week.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Henna Paste:
How to prepare: Mix 2-3 tablespoons of henna powder with enough water to form a thick paste. Let it sit for 2-3 hours.
How to take: Apply the henna paste to the affected areas and leave it on for 1-2 hours before rinsing with water. Repeat 2-3 times a week for best results.

Black Seed Oil Application:
How to prepare: Use cold-pressed black seed oil directly or mix 1 teaspoon of black seed powder with a little water to make a paste.
How to take: Apply the black seed oil or paste to the affected areas 1-2 times a day to help reduce inflammation and soothe the skin.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of henna paste applied cautiously; consult a healthcare professional for black seed application.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 tablespoon of henna paste applied as described; small amounts of black seed oil.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of henna paste and black seed oil as described.
Elderly: Full doses of henna paste and black seed oil, but monitor for any skin sensitivity or irritation.
Siddha_description:
Vettiver (Vetiver) Infusion:
How to prepare: Boil 1/4 cup of dried Vettiver roots in 2 cups of water for 15-20 minutes. Strain and let it cool.
How to take: Apply the cooled Vettiver infusion to affected skin areas using a cotton ball 2-3 times a day to soothe irritation.

Karisalankanni (False Daisy) Paste:
How to prepare: Grind a handful of fresh Karisalankanni leaves with a little water to make a smooth paste.
How to take: Apply the paste directly to the affected areas of the skin and leave it on for 30 minutes before rinsing off with lukewarm water. Use once a day.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of Vettiver infusion (patch test first); Karisalankanni paste can be used cautiously.
Children (6-12 Years): Vettiver infusion and Karisalankanni paste can be applied as described.
Teens/Adults: Vettiver infusion and Karisalankanni paste can be used as described.
Elderly: Vettiver infusion and Karisalankanni paste can be used, but monitor for skin sensitivity.
Homeopathy_description:
Sulphur:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Sulphur liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Graphites:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Graphites liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Triphala: 
Take 1 teaspoon of Triphala powder with warm water before bedtime. Alternatively, follow dosage instructions on the product label.

Isabgol (Psyllium Husk): 
Mix 1-2 teaspoons of Isabgol in a glass of water and drink immediately, preferably before bedtime.

Ghee: 
Consume 1-2 teaspoons of ghee on an empty stomach in the morning, or add to warm dishes.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.consult a pediatrician.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Use very small amounts of Isabgol (1/4 teaspoon) mixed with water; a small amount of ghee can be added to food.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon Triphala powder with warm water; 1 teaspoon Isabgol in water; 1 teaspoon ghee.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1 teaspoon Triphala powder with warm water; 1-2 teaspoons Isabgol in water; 1-2 teaspoons ghee.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1 teaspoon Triphala powder with warm water; 1 teaspoon Isabgol in water; 1 teaspoon ghee.

Unani_description:
Figs:
How to prepare: Soak 2-3 dried figs in water overnight.
How to take: Eat the soaked figs in the morning on an empty stomach to help promote bowel movements and relieve constipation.

Flaxseed Powder:
How to prepare: Grind 1-2 tablespoons of flaxseeds into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix the flaxseed powder into a glass of water or yogurt and consume once daily to help improve digestion and regularity.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/2 soaked fig; small amounts of flaxseed powder mixed with food (consult a healthcare professional first).
Children (6-12 Years): 1-2 soaked figs and 1 teaspoon of flaxseed powder.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of figs and flaxseed powder as described.
Elderly: Full doses of figs and flaxseed powder as described, but monitor for any digestive sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Kadukkai (Kadukkai) Powder:
How to prepare: Dry the Kadukkai fruit and grind it into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder with warm water and drink once a day before bedtime to help relieve constipation.

Nellikai (Amla) Juice:
How to prepare: Crush 2-3 fresh Nellikai (Amla) fruits to extract the juice and strain it.
How to take: Drink 1 tablespoon of Nellikai juice once a day, preferably in the morning, to improve digestion and relieve constipation.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder mixed with warm water; 1 teaspoon of Nellikai juice.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1 tablespoon of Nellikai juice.
Teens/Adults: 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1 tablespoon of Nellikai juice.
Elderly: 1 teaspoon of Kadukkai powder or 1 tablespoon of Nellikai juice.
Homeopathy_description:
Nux Vomica:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Nux Vomica liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Lycopodium:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Lycopodium liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.

Ayurvedha_description:
Ashwagandha:
Take 300-500 mg of ashwagandha powder or capsules before bedtime, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Brahmi:
Take 300-500 mg of brahmi powder or capsules daily, preferably in the evening, or as directed on the product label.

Milk with Turmeric:
Mix 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder into a cup of warm milk. Drink this before bedtime.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid these remedies, consult a pediatrician for sleep issues.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Use very small amounts of turmeric in milk, ashwagandha and brahmi should be avoided unless prescribed by a doctor.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 teaspoon turmeric in warm milk before bedtime, use ashwagandha and brahmi only if prescribed by a healthcare provider.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1/2 teaspoon turmeric in warm milk before bedtime, 300-500 mg ashwagandha and brahmi daily.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1/2 teaspoon turmeric in warm milk before bedtime, 300 mg ashwagandha and brahmi daily.

Unani_description:
Saffron Milk:
How to prepare: Heat 1 cup of milk and add a pinch of saffron strands. Allow it to simmer for a few minutes.
How to take: Drink the saffron milk before bedtime to help promote relaxation and improve sleep quality.

Chamomile Tea:
How to prepare: Steep 1-2 teaspoons of dried chamomile flowers in a cup of boiling water for about 5-10 minutes. Strain before drinking.
How to take: Drink chamomile tea 30 minutes before bed to help calm the mind and support better sleep.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 cup of diluted saffron milk; chamomile tea can be given in small amounts (consult a healthcare professional first).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of saffron milk and 1/2 cup of chamomile tea.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of saffron milk and chamomile tea as described.
Elderly: Full doses of saffron milk and chamomile tea, but monitor for any sensitivities.
Siddha_description:
Vallarai (Vallaris solanacea) Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of fresh Vallarai leaves in 2 cups of water for 10-15 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Vallarai tea before bedtime to help promote relaxation and improve sleep quality.

Thuthuvalai (Thuthuvalai) Juice:
How to prepare: Crush a handful of fresh Thuthuvalai leaves to extract the juice, then strain it well.
How to take: Drink 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice once a day in the evening to help calm the mind and alleviate insomnia.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Vallarai tea (diluted).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of Vallarai tea or 1 teaspoon of Thuthuvalai juice.
Teens/Adults: 1 cup of Vallarai tea or 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice.
Elderly: 1 cup of Vallarai tea or 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice.
Homeopathy_description:
Coffea Cruda:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Coffea Cruda liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon 30 minutes before bedtime to help promote sleep.

Passiflora:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Passiflora liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon 30 minutes before bedtime for relaxation and better sleep.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Garlic:
Consume 1-2 raw garlic cloves daily or take garlic supplements as directed.

Arjuna Bark: 
Take 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of arjuna bark powder with warm water, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Ashwagandha: 
Take 300-500 mg of ashwagandha powder or capsules daily, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year):Not recommended. consult a pediatrician.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid garlic supplements, very small amounts of arjuna bark (if approved) and ashwagandha (under doctor’s guidance).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 clove garlic, 1/4 teaspoon arjuna bark powder, 100-250 mg ashwagandha.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1-2 cloves garlic, 1/2 to 1 teaspoon arjuna bark powder, 300-500 mg ashwagandha.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1-2 cloves garlic, 1/2 teaspoon arjuna bark powder, 300 mg ashwagandha.

Unani_description:
Garlic:
How to prepare: Crush 2-3 cloves of fresh garlic and let them sit for 10 minutes to activate beneficial compounds.
How to take: Consume the crushed garlic raw or mix it into your meals once daily to help lower blood pressure.

Olive Oil:
How to prepare: Use extra virgin olive oil for its health benefits.
How to take: Incorporate 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil into your daily diet, either in salads or for cooking, to support heart health.

Fennel Seeds:
How to prepare: Lightly crush 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds to release their oils.
How to take: Boil the crushed seeds in a cup of water for 5-10 minutes, strain, and drink as tea once daily.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 clove of garlic (cooked) and 1/2 teaspoon of fennel seeds (in food).
Children (6-12 Years): 1 clove of garlic (cooked) and 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds; 1/2 cup of fennel tea.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of garlic, olive oil, and fennel seeds as described.
Elderly: Full doses of garlic, olive oil, and fennel seeds, but monitor for any sensitivities or interactions with medications.
Siddha_description:
Karunthulasi (Holy Basil) Tea:
How to prepare: Boil 10-12 fresh Karunthulasi leaves in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Karunthulasi tea once a day to help lower blood pressure and improve overall heart health.

Thuthuvalai (Thuthuvalai) Juice:
How to prepare: Crush a handful of fresh Thuthuvalai leaves to extract the juice, then strain it well.
How to take: Drink 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice once a day in the morning to support healthy blood pressure levels.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1 teaspoon of Karunthulasi tea (diluted).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 cup of Karunthulasi tea or 1 teaspoon of Thuthuvalai juice.
Teens/Adults: 1 cup of Karunthulasi tea or 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice.
Elderly: 1 cup of Karunthulasi tea or 1 tablespoon of Thuthuvalai juice.

How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until blood pressure stabilizes.

Natrum Muriaticum:

How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.

Ayurvedha_description:
Guggul: 
Take 500 mg of guggul capsules, 2-3 times daily, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Triphala:
Take 1 teaspoon of Triphala powder with warm water before bedtime, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Honey with Lemon: 
Mix 1-2 teaspoons of honey and the juice of half a lemon in a glass of warm water. Drink this on an empty stomach in the morning.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid these remedies; consult a pediatrician.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid guggul and Triphala; small amount of honey with lemon (if approved) in warm water.
Children (6-12 Years): 250 mg guggul; 1/4 teaspoon Triphala powder; 1 teaspoon honey with lemon in warm water.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 500 mg guggul; 1 teaspoon Triphala powder; 1-2 teaspoons honey with lemon in warm water.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 500 mg guggul; 1 teaspoon Triphala powder; 1-2 teaspoons honey with lemon in warm water.

Unani_description:
Honey with Vinegar:
How to prepare: Mix 1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with 1 tablespoon of honey in a glass of warm water.
How to take: Drink this mixture once daily, preferably in the morning on an empty stomach, to help support weight loss and boost metabolism.

Black Seed Powder:
How to prepare: Grind 1-2 teaspoons of black seeds (kalonji) into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix the black seed powder with yogurt or water and consume once daily to help promote weight management.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of honey with vinegar (consult a healthcare professional first); 1/4 teaspoon of black seed powder mixed into food.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 teaspoon of honey with vinegar and 1/2 teaspoon of black seed powder.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of honey with vinegar and black seed powder as described.
Elderly: Full doses of honey with vinegar and black seed powder, but monitor for any sensitivities.
Siddha_description:
Kollu (Horse Gram) Soup:
How to prepare: Boil 1/4 cup of soaked Kollu in 3 cups of water for 30 minutes. Strain and season with salt and pepper to taste.
How to take: Drink 1 cup of Kollu soup once a day to help promote weight loss and boost metabolism.

Vilva (Vilva) Powder:
How to prepare: Dry the Vilva fruit and grind it into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder with warm water or yogurt and consume once a day to aid in weight management.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Vilva powder mixed with yogurt (if no allergies).
Children (6-12 Years): 1/2 teaspoon of Kollu soup or Vilva powder.
Teens/Adults: 1 cup of Kollu soup and 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Elderly: 1 cup of Kollu soup and 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Homeopathy_description:
Calcarea Carbonica:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Calcarea Carbonica liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours to support weight management.

Phytolacca:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Phytolacca liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours to assist in weight loss.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.

Ayurvedha_description:
Aloe Vera:
Drink 1-2 tablespoons of aloe vera juice daily, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Ashoka Tree:
Take 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of ashoka bark powder with warm water, or follow the dosage instructions on the product label.

Ginger:
Drink 1 cup of ginger tea (made with 1-inch fresh ginger boiled in 1-2 cups of water) 2-3 times daily, or use ginger powder (1/4 teaspoon) in warm water or smoothies.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid these remedies; consult a pediatrician.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid aloe vera juice and ashoka tree; very small amounts of ginger tea (if approved).
Children (6-12 Years): Small amounts of aloe vera juice (1 teaspoon); 1/4 teaspoon ashoka powder; very mild ginger tea.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: 1-2 tablespoons aloe vera juice; 1/2 to 1 teaspoon ashoka powder; 1 cup ginger tea 2-3 times daily.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): 1-2 tablespoons aloe vera juice; 1/2 teaspoon ashoka powder; 1 cup ginger tea 1-2 times daily.

Unani_description:
Fenugreek Seeds:
How to prepare: Soak 1-2 tablespoons of fenugreek seeds in water overnight. Drain and rinse the seeds in the morning.
How to take: Chew the soaked seeds or mix them into yogurt and consume daily to help regulate menstrual cycles and alleviate cramps.

Black Cumin (Kalonji) Powder:
How to prepare: Grind 1 teaspoon of black cumin seeds into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix the black cumin powder into a glass of warm water or yogurt and drink once daily to support hormonal balance and menstrual health.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of fenugreek seeds (consult a healthcare professional first); 1/4 teaspoon of black cumin powder mixed into food.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 teaspoon of soaked fenugreek seeds and 1/2 teaspoon of black cumin powder.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of fenugreek seeds and black cumin powder as described.
Elderly: Full doses of fenugreek seeds and black cumin powder, but monitor for any sensitivities.

Veliparuthi (Vernonia cinerea) Decoction:
How to prepare: Boil 1 tablespoon of dried Veliparuthi leaves in 2 cups of water for 10-15 minutes. Strain before use.
How to take: Drink 1/4 cup (approximately 60 ml) of Veliparuthi decoction 1-2 times a day to help regulate menstrual cycles and ease discomfort.

Vilva (Vilva) Powder:
How to prepare: Dry the Vilva fruit and grind it into a fine powder.
How to take: Mix 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder with warm water or yogurt and consume once a day to help alleviate menstrual symptoms.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Not recommended.
Children (6-12 Years): 1/4 teaspoon of Vilva powder mixed with yogurt (if no allergies).
Teens/Adults: 1/4 cup of Veliparuthi decoction and 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Elderly: 1/4 cup of Veliparuthi decoction and 1 teaspoon of Vilva powder.
Homeopathy_description:
Pulsatilla:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Pulsatilla liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until symptoms improve.

Sepia:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Sepia liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours until you feel better.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.

Ayurvedha_description:
Bhringaraj:
Apply bhringaraj oil directly to the scalp, massaging gently for 5-10 minutes, 2-3 times a week. Alternatively, take bhringaraj capsules as directed on the product label.

Amla:
Apply amla oil to the scalp and hair, massaging gently for 5-10 minutes, 2-3 times a week. Alternatively, take amla powder mixed with water or in capsule form as directed on the product label.

Hibiscus Oil:
Apply hibiscus oil to the scalp and hair, massaging gently for 5-10 minutes, 2-3 times a week. You can also mix hibiscus oil with other carrier oils for better results.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Avoid these remedies; consult a pediatrician.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Avoid bhringaraj and amla oil; use very diluted hibiscus oil with caution.
Children (6-12 Years): Use bhringaraj and amla oil sparingly; apply hibiscus oil 1-2 times a week.
Teens (13-18 Years) and Adults: Apply bhringaraj and amla oil 2-3 times a week; use hibiscus oil 2-3 times a week.
Elderly (Above 60 Years): Apply bhringaraj and amla oil 1-2 times a week; use hibiscus oil 1-2 times a week.
Yoga_description:
Do this yoga
Age: 5-18   (10 times)
Age: 18-60   (20 times)
Unani_description:
Fenugreek Hair Mask:
How to prepare: Soak 2 tablespoons of fenugreek seeds in water overnight. Drain, then grind the seeds into a fine paste with a little water.
How to take: Apply the fenugreek paste to the scalp and hair, leaving it on for 30-60 minutes before washing it out with a mild shampoo. Use this treatment 1-2 times a week to promote hair growth and strengthen hair.

Coconut Oil Massage:
How to prepare: Use pure coconut oil, preferably extra virgin.
How to take: Warm 2 tablespoons of coconut oil and massage it gently into the scalp and hair. Leave it on for at least 1 hour or overnight before washing it out. Repeat this 2-3 times a week to nourish the hair and prevent hair loss.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Small amounts of fenugreek paste applied cautiously; coconut oil can be used for gentle scalp massage.
Children (6-12 Years): 1 tablespoon of fenugreek paste and coconut oil as described.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of fenugreek paste and coconut oil as described.
Elderly: Full doses of fenugreek paste and coconut oil, but monitor for any scalp sensitivity.
Siddha_description:
Karisalankanni (Eclipta Prostrata) Oil:
How to prepare: Grind fresh Karisalankanni leaves and mix them with coconut oil. Heat the mixture gently for about 10-15 minutes. Let it cool and strain the oil.
How to take: Massage the Karisalankanni oil onto the scalp and hair, leave it on for at least 30 minutes, and then wash it out with a mild shampoo. Use 2-3 times a week.

Tulsi (Holy Basil) Hair Rinse:
How to prepare: Boil 1/4 cup of fresh Tulsi leaves in 2 cups of water for 10-15 minutes. Strain the liquid and let it cool.
How to take: Use the Tulsi rinse as a final wash after shampooing your hair. Pour it over your scalp and hair, leave it on for 5-10 minutes, and then rinse with water. Use 1-2 times a week.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not recommended.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Use very small amounts of Tulsi rinse (patch test first); avoid Karisalankanni oil.
Children (6-12 Years): 1-2 tablespoons of Karisalankanni oil or Tulsi rinse as described.
Teens/Adults: Full doses of Karisalankanni oil and Tulsi rinse as described.
Elderly: Full doses of Karisalankanni oil and Tulsi rinse, but monitor for any scalp sensitivity.
Homeopathy_description:
Phosphorus:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Phosphorus liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours to promote healthy hair growth.

Natrum Muriaticum:
How to prepare: Dissolve 5 drops of Natrum Muriaticum liquid in 1/2 cup of water.
How to take: Drink 1 teaspoon every 4 hours to help with hair health.

Who should consume:
Infants (Below 1 Year): Not safe.
Toddlers (1-5 Years): Only if a doctor says it's okay.
Children (6-12 Years): Only if a healthcare professional recommends it.
Teens/Adults: Safe as directed.
Elderly: Safe, but watch for any side effects.
